verses.text: 講道與說方言的恩賜你們要追求愛，也要熱切地渴慕屬靈的恩賜，特別是作先知宣講信息的恩賜。

words.note: Lit. 'thirstily admire/desire'
Lit. 'grace bestowed'
Lit. 'one who knows first'

verses.text: 原來那說方言的不是對人說，而是對 神說，因為沒有人能聽得懂；他是在靈裡講奧祕的事。
但那講道的是對人講說，使他們得著造就、安慰和勸勉。

words.note: Lit. 'speak the way/doctrine'

verses.text: 那說方言的是造就自己，但那講道的是造就教會。

words.note: Lit. 'teaching assembly'

verses.text: 我願意你們都說方言，但我更願意你們都講道；因為那說方言的，如果不翻譯出來使教會得著造就，就遠不如那講道的了。
弟兄們，你們想想，如果我到你們那裡去，只說方言，不向你們講有關啟示、知識、預言，或教訓的話，那我對你們有甚麼益處呢？

words.note: Refers to fellow believers in Christ.
Reduplication indicates a softened or brief action.
In Bible, refers to glossolalia or foreign languages.

verses.text: 甚至那些沒有生命卻能發聲的東西，例如簫或琴，如果音調不分，怎能使人知道所彈所奏的是甚麼呢？

words.definition: even, to go so far as to

words.note: Lit. 'east-west', general term for things/objects.
General term for zither-like or lute-like instruments.
Nominalizes the following verb(s) or introduces a passive structure.
Nominalizes the following verb(s) or introduces a passive structure.

verses.text: 又如果軍號所發的聲音不清楚，誰會準備作戰呢？

words.note: Nominalizes the following verb(s) or introduces a passive structure.

verses.text: 你們也是這樣，如果用舌頭發出人聽不懂的話來，人怎會知道你所講的是甚麼呢？這樣，你們就是向空氣說話了。

words.note: Verb with potential complement (cannot understand).
Particle indicating direction or result after a verb.
Nominalizes the following verb(s) or introduces a passive structure.

verses.text: 世上有那麼多種語言，但沒有一種是沒有意義的。
我若不明白某一種語言的意思，在那講的人來看，我就是個外國人；在我來說，那講話的人也是個外國人。

words.note: 來看 (láikàn) means 'from the perspective of'.
來說 (láishuō) means 'in one's opinion, as far as one is concerned'.

verses.text: 你們也是這樣，你們既然熱切地渴慕屬靈的恩賜，就應當追求多多得著造就教會的恩賜。

words.note: Connects an adjective to a verb, forming an adverbial phrase.
Often used in a religious context for spiritual longing.
Resultative compound meaning 'to succeed in obtaining'.
In a spiritual context, means to strengthen or improve character.

verses.text: 所以，說方言的應當祈求，使他能把方言翻譯出來。

words.note: Refers to glossolalia, the spiritual gift of speaking in unknown languages.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'the one who speaks in tongues'.
Marks the object of a verb when moved before the verb for emphasis or specific action.
Indicates completion or the result of something appearing or being brought out.

verses.text: 我若用方言禱告，是我的靈在禱告，我的理智並沒有作用。

words.note: Used with negatives (沒, 不) to strengthen the negation.

verses.text: 那麼我應當怎樣行呢？我要用靈禱告，也要用理智禱告；我要用靈歌唱，也要用理智歌唱。
不然，如果你用靈讚美，在場那些不明白的人，因為不知道你在說甚麼，怎能在你感謝的時候說「阿們」呢？

words.note: Refers to the human spirit or the Holy Spirit.
Indicates an action in progress.
Transliteration of Hebrew 'amen', meaning 'so be it'.

verses.text: 你感謝固然是好，但別人卻得不著造就。

words.note: Older usage; modern equivalent is 得不到 (débudào).

verses.text: 我感謝 神，我說方言比你們大家都多。

words.note: In biblical context, refers to speaking in unknown languages or glossolalia.

verses.text: 但在教會中，我寧願用理智說五句話去教導人，勝過用方言說萬句話。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here, e.g., 'in the church'.
Indicates purpose or direction for the following verb.

verses.text: 弟兄們，你們在思想上不要作小孩子，卻要在惡事上作嬰孩，在思想上作成年人。

words.note: Common address for fellow believers in Christian context.
Used as a scope marker here, 'in the area of thought'.
不要 (búyào) together means 'don't'.
Used as a scope marker here, 'in the area of evil deeds'.
Used as a scope marker here, 'in the area of thought'.

verses.text: 律法上記著說：「主說：我要藉著說別種話的人，用外國人的嘴唇，對這人民說話；雖然這樣，他們還是不聽我。」
可見說方言不是要給信主的人作記號，而是要給未信的人；講道不是要給未信的人，而是要給信主的人作記號。

words.note: In a religious context, refers to speaking in tongues.

words.definition: to be used for, for the purpose of
to be used for, for the purpose of

words.note: In 1 Corinthians 14, refers to 'prophesying'.

words.definition: to be used for, for the purpose of
to be used for, for the purpose of

verses.text: 所以，如果全教會聚在一起的時候，大家都說方言，有不明白的人或未信的人進來，不是要說你們瘋了嗎？

words.note: In a religious context, refers to speaking in tongues.

verses.text: 如果大家都講道，有未信的人或不明白的人進來，他就會被眾人勸服而知罪，被眾人審問了。

words.note: In 1 Corinthians 14, refers to 'prophesying'.

verses.text: 他心裡隱祕的事被顯露出來，他就必俯伏敬拜 神，宣告說：「 神真的是在你們中間了。」

words.note: Often preceded by a space (　) for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Often preceded by a space (　) for reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 弟兄們，那麼應該怎麼辦呢？你們聚集在一起的時候，各人或有詩歌，或有教訓，或有啟示，或有方言，或有翻譯出來的話，一切都應該能造就人。

words.note: Used collectively for fellow Christians.
Refers to spiritual instruction or doctrine.
Divine revelation, prophetic insight.
Refers to miraculous, often unknown, languages.
Refers to spiritual building up or encouragement.

verses.heading: Church Order

verses.text: 如果有人說方言，只可以有兩個人，或最多三個人，並且要輪流說，同時要有一個人翻譯。

words.note: Refers to speaking in miraculous languages.

verses.text: 如果沒有人翻譯，他就應當在會中閉口，只對自己和對 神說好了。

words.note: Refers to a church assembly.

verses.text: 講道的，也只可以兩三個人講，其餘的人要衡量他們所講的。

words.note: Refers to expounding spiritual truth or the Gospel.
Here, refers to 'those who preach'.
Here, refers to 'what they preach'.

verses.text: 在座的有人得了啟示，那先講的人就應當住口。

words.note: Here, refers to 'those who are present'.
Divine revelation, prophetic insight.
Here, refers to 'the one who spoke first'.

verses.text: 因為你們都可以輪流講道，好讓大家都可以學習，都可以得到勉勵。

words.note: Lit. 'speak the Way/truth'.

verses.text: 先知的靈是受先知控制的，

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Here, nominalizes the verb phrase '受先知控制'.

verses.text: 因為 神不是混亂的，而是和平的。

words.note: The leading space is a reverence mark in some Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 婦女在聚會中應當閉口，好像在聖徒的眾教會中一樣，因為她們是不准講話的；就如律法所說的，她們應該順服。

words.note: Functions as a locative suffix following a noun to indicate 'in/among'.
Lit. 'holy disciples'.
Often used before collective nouns or groups.
Lit. 'teaching assembly'.
Functions as a locative suffix following a noun to indicate 'in/among'.
Forms a descriptive clause or nominalizes the preceding phrase.
Indicates a passive construction or nominalizes the following verb.
Nominalizes the preceding verb phrase '律法所說'.

verses.text: 如果她們想要學甚麼，可以在家裡問自己的丈夫，因為婦女在聚會中講話原是可恥的。

words.note: Functions as a locative suffix following a noun to indicate 'in/among'.
Forms a descriptive clause or indicates emphasis.

verses.text: 難道 神的道是從你們出來的嗎？是單單臨到你們的嗎？

words.note: Used to introduce a rhetorical question, implying 'surely not?' or 'could it be that...?'
Refers to God's word or truth; akin to 'logos'.

verses.text: 如果有人自以為是先知或是屬靈的，他就應該知道我寫給你們的是主的命令；

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 如果有人不理會，別人也不必理會他。

words.note: Often used with '不' to mean 'need not' or 'not necessarily'.

verses.text: 所以我的弟兄們，你們要熱切地追求講道的恩賜，也不要禁止說方言。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers, spiritual brothers.
In a biblical context, often refers to inspired proclamation, not just teaching.
Lit. 'gracious bestowal'; a gift from God.
Used with '不' to form a negative imperative: 'do not'.
In context, refers to glossolalia, the spiritual gift of speaking in unknown languages.

verses.text: 凡事都要規規矩矩地按著次序行。

words.note: A reduplicative adverb, emphasizing order and propriety.
